channel.title: MYSQL Issues
channel.description: So I have this nice source that I've been wanting to use, but I am unable to because it has been connected to a database via MySQL. I am needing help with possibly changing or just removing the MySQL.

item.title: MYSQL Issues
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

The fact that its already made for MySQL is very convenient. Have you considered making a local database and using its function?

Read full topic

item.title: MYSQL Issues
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

If you want to just disable the feature for a while, then you can remove any instances of it being called. For instance, when a player logs in/out, it probably calls to the method to connect. Look in server.java inside initialize() for:

SQL.connect();

just comment that out.

Read full topic

item.title: MYSQL Issues
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

It might be a better idea to look for the connection info in config, server or mysql.java and set up your own MySQL database. You can find tutorials on this by using the search function.

Read full topic

item.title: MYSQL Issues
item.dc:creator: @zotar zotar
item.description:
@zotar wrote:

runescape sucks:

If you have open in an IDE, there’s probably a mysql class file. Take that, and delete it. There will probably be errors that were pointing to that file, remove those and you should be fine. There may also be a highscores or a vote class, remove those aswell.

Hmm, I will give it a shot. Will keep this updated. Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: MYSQL Issues

item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

If you have open in an IDE, there’s probably a mysql class file. Take that, and delete it. There will probably be errors that were pointing to that file, remove those and you should be fine. There may also be a highscores or a vote class, remove those aswell.
